application.name: add_field
application.description: adds a field to a flat-file

option.name: field
option.description: the 1-based index for the new field

option.name: label
option.description: the string to label the new field on the first line

option.name: value
option.description: the value to place in the new field

details.item: if no "label" is provided, the "value" (if provided) will be used.
a field of either 0 or 1 may be used to indicate the first position.
if a field value of -1 indicates that the field should be appended to each line.

application.example: # add a Network-ID field at the beginning of each linei in a dt file net_id=1234 output=$wdir/tmp/$$_`basename $file | sed s/.gz$//` gzdog $file | add_field -l "Network-ID" -v $net_id -f 1 -d "$delim" \ > $output
